results.title: Archer
results.creator_credit: Maya Iceton, Roadshow Television, Coote and Carroll and Denny Lawrence
results.brief_description: Brett Climo plays Dave Power, a young and ambitious caretaker of a racehorse named Archer. In order to get Archer to the 1861 Melbourne Cup, where the horse must compete. Power takes him on a 600-mile outback odyssey, fraught with excitment and peril. The horse then wins the race. Also features 18 year old Nicole Kidman in a crucial role Based on a true story of perhaps Australia’s greatest racehorse

results.title: Archaeology in the laboratory
results.creator_credit: Service du Film de Recherche and J.P. Baux
results.brief_description: Presents a study of a cave, the Grotte du Lazaret, near Nice in France. Reveals much about the life of man 130,000 years ago. Includes studies of sedimentation, microscopic slides, isotopes of uranium and oxygen and pollen examinations. Gives a detailed analysis of man’s organization in this cave. Suitable for Lower-Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Arcadia
results.creator_credit: Paola Garofali, Greg Waters, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
‘I know that you’re there, because I can feel you. Why don’t you come out and play with me. In the dark I hear you breathing. Watch out for the Hairy Man…’
In Arcadia nothing is what it seems.
Cast: Hunter Page, Justine Saunders, Ursula Yovich, Damien Garvey, Pauline Lampton

results.title: Ararat
results.brief_description: When Noel Matthews watched this old film to see if it could go into the MAP project he realised that it was of enormous personal significance to him. This footage of Ararat township circa 1930 is combined with a voiceover by Noel explaining why watching this film had such a powerful effect. One of earliest submissions to the MAP project.

results.title: Araha Ana Romo
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Martin Cohen and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Solomon Islands”.
This documentary shows the bartering system, traditions and ceremonies on the Solomon Islands, particularly the ceremonies surrounding the election and inauguration of a new chief on one of the islands.

results.title: Arafura to Alice
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Nick Torrens
results.brief_description: A film showing life in Darwin, Tennant Creek, Alice Springs, and Ayers Rock in the early 1980’s. This demanding, tough and often inhospitable part of Australia is inhabited by a special type of Australian and is opening up to anyone who is prepared to accept the challenge that the Northern Territory offers.

results.title: Arafat: Behind the myth
results.creator_credit: Anthony Geffen, BBC Enterprises and WGBH (Boston)
